intro: Didymocarpus platycalyx, commonly known as the broad-calyx sandarac, is a flowering plant native to Southeast Asia. It is a member of the Rubiaceae family, which includes many species of shrubs and trees. The plant is characterized by its simple, opposite leaves and small, clustered white flowers. Its fruit is a capsule that splits open to release seeds, and it is often found in moist, shaded environments. Due to its ornamental value, it is occasionally cultivated in tropical gardens.
